definition: to separate/to partition/to stand or lie between/at a distance from/after or at an interval of
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
to be cut off from the rest of the world (idiom)

sentences.english: Known from a single stream in an isolated cloud forest.
sentences.chinese: 這種蛙類曾生活在一個與世隔絕的霧林的溪流內。

sentences.english: No gulf that perfect love will not bridge.
sentences.chinese: 沒有任何隔絕，完全的愛不能造橋。

sentences.english: In the country near D---- a man lived quite alone.
sentences.chinese: 在迪涅附近的一個鄉村裏住着一個與世隔絕的人。

sentences.english: You're isolated in avast, empty continent.
sentences.chinese: 你被隔絕於一個宏大而空無的大陸。

sentences.english: The ice shelves currently insulate the Antartic continent from wind.
sentences.chinese: 冰架目前使南極洲和風隔絕。

sentences.english: The playwright cocooned himself in a world of pretence.
sentences.chinese: 這個劇作家與世隔絕，生活在一個虛幻的世界裏。

sentences.english: Part 4-part 5: Elderly people easily become socially isolated.
sentences.chinese: 上了年紀的人很容易變得與社會隔絕。

sentences.english: eg：The rubber seal is designed to keep out all the moisture.
sentences.chinese: 橡膠的密封墊是用以隔絕溼氣的。

sentences.english: John discovers and outside isolation that kind of feeling is unendurable.
sentences.chinese: 約翰發現與外界隔絕的那種感覺是難以忍受的。

sentences.english: You cannot grow to Christlikeness in isolation.
sentences.chinese: 與世隔絕，你是不會成長，活出基督的。

sentences.english: Living in a countryside tends to insulate us from the outside world.
sentences.chinese: 住在農村會使我們與外面的世界隔絕。

sentences.english: In the meantime, you have to insulate yourself from his moods.
sentences.chinese: 同時，你必須將你自己隔絕在他的情緒之外。

sentences.english: The isolation and cut-off feeling can be dire.
sentences.chinese: 與世隔絕和孤立感是非常可怕的。

sentences.english: With double-layered porcelain insulation, a full cup of nice warm, hot tea will never boil your hand.
sentences.chinese: 倒滿杯的熱開水，雙層陶瓷隔絕了熱度讓杯緣不燙手。

sentences.english: The mind is like a screen hiding our real reality.
sentences.chinese: 頭腦就像屏幛，讓我們與真實生活隔絕。

sentences.english: In Milan in the 1600s, three-quarters of the female nobility were cloistered.
sentences.chinese: 在17世紀的米蘭，四分之三的女性貴族都與世隔絕。

definition: to be cut off from the rest of the world (idiom)
to be far from/to keep away from
to pry into or spy on/to snoop/to peep/to poke one's nose into/to peer/to get a glimpse of
to live alone/to spend time alone (or with a significant other)
hidden beneath the surface/buried and concealed
